metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2178 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The apache-auth.conf, apache-nohome.conf, apache-noscript.conf, andapache-overflows.conf files in Fail2ban before 0.8.10 do not properlyvalidate log messages, which allows remote attackers to block arbitrary IPaddresses via certain messages in a request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fail2ban - 0.8.10-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fail2ban package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.10-1').
